description: Apple continues to grow in the enterprise, supporting this push with regular enterprise-focused enhancements for its platforms. We can see the results as Mac adoption sets new records. But the company can still do more for enterprise IT. To get a sense of some improvements it could make, I caught up with Apu Pavithran, the CEO of device management vendor Hexnode
title: Hexnode CEO sees 3 pain points Apple should fix for IT

description:
A public war of words has erupted between cloud infrastructure leader Cloudflare and AI search company Perplexity, with both sides making serious allegations about each other’s technical competence in a dispute that industry analysts say exposes fundamental flaws in how enterprises protect content from AI data collection.

The controversy began when Cloudflare published a scathing technical report accusing Perplexity of “stealth crawling” — using disguised web browsers to sneak past website blocks and scrape content that site owners explicitly wanted to keep away from AI training. Perplexity quickly fired back, accusing Cloudflare of creating a “publicity stunt” by misattributing millio
title: AI crawlers vs. web defenses: Cloudflare-Perplexity fight reveals cracks in internet trust

description:
The unemployment rate for technology workers changed little last month, according to an analysis of the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) latest lackluster jobs report.

Overall, US employers added just 73,000 jobs last month, the Labor Department reported Friday; that was well short of the 115,000 jobs expected.

IT unemployment rose slightly from 2.8% in June to 2.9% in July, according to an analysis of jobs data by the nonprofit trade association CompTIA. The overall national unemployment rate inched up 0.1% to
title: Tech employment holds steady as job growth slows and AI-driven roles surge
